subject: Logotypes
Indians, American
lead_paragraph: The College of William and Mary’s new logo sheds the two feathers that the N.C.A.A. deemed offensive to American Indians. The logo, revealed yesterday, updates the familiar W&M monogram and uses the school’s more traditional colors of green and gold instead of the more recent green and yellow. Last year, the N.C.A.A. ruled William and Mary could keep its Tribe nickname but could not display its athletic logo with feathers at N.C.A.A. championship events or play host to N.C.A.A. tournament games at which the logo would be shown.
